But it comes in the same month that a new tax was added to our energy bills - a nuclear tax to pay for Sizewell C - and it‚Äôs also ¬£1bn. Kinda standing still aren‚Äôt we..:)

author: eurostarjustin.bsky.social
text: Maybe we should build HS2 in full and increase capacity on the network. It was never just about speed.

author: torstenbell.bsky.social
text: If you prefer your investment big and tangible, we are supporting the expansion of Heathrow and Gatwick airports, plus the construction of Sizewell C

author: qagggy.bsky.social
text: High speed rail is a non-trivial effort with massive construction impacts and steep costs but it's never going to be cheaper, so governments should really start a semi-permanent program of building the most obvious corridors...or are we just going to keep flying from Seattle to Portland forever?

author: johnslingermp.bsky.social
text:
We have the tools to end HIV.

The government's new HIV strategy includes home testing kits via the NHS app, anti-stigma training for hospital staff, and a national programme to support people accessing life-saving treatment.

text:

The programme was funded by @arckss.bsky.social and is the first of its kind in the UK.

arc-kss.nihr.ac.uk/news/new-pro...

author: anonopin.bsky.social
text: If HS2 was a motorway, it would have been built by now! But because new rail projects are minutely analysed with this "value for the taxpayer" nonsense. If road building was held to the same level of scrutiny, a sizable amount of the road network would still be cart tracks.

author: drpauldorfman.bsky.social
text:
The deal to build the Sizewell C, two #nuclear reactors using the European Pressurised Reactor (EPR) design, using the Regulated Asset Base (RAB) finance model was inevitably a bad one for the UK public.
policybrief.org/briefs/sizew...

author: richard.hebditch.org
text:
16 new inquiries from the Commons' Public Accounts Committee. Including environmental regulation, regulating for growth and unlocking land for housing. Should be a busy new year for consultation response writing with new NPPF as well...

author: oxfordarchaeology.bsky.social
text:
Soft spot for scrapers? Batty about burins? Loopy for a laurel leaf?

If this sounds like you, you'll be thrilled to learn that #OCAArchTeam excavations, ahead of Sizewell C, have uncovered abundant evidence of stone tool use through the Neolithic and Early Bronze Age

author: garethdennis.uk
text:
Remember when HS2 to Leeds was cancelled by the NIC's shitty maths and fundamental lack of expertise, and Leeds was thrown the bone of "you'll get trams" and I said those would never be delivered?
